alert.note: Alert for Greater Portland Metro Area; Lower Columbia (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 7:52PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...STICKING SNOW POSSIBLE AS LOW AS 500 FEET THIS EVENING... A band of steady precipitation was moving northward across the Portland and Vancouver metro area as of 745 PM. While the snow level is generally 1000 feet tonight, this band of precipitation may result in quick, slushy snow accumulations down to elevations as low as 500 feet and locally a little lower. Accumulations of up to 1 inch are possible as low as 500 feet in elevation, with spotty dustings possible for lower elevations. This particular band of precipitation should diminish by 11 PM, but additional rain and snow showers are possible tonight, with snow levels remaining around 500 to 700 feet.

area.areaDesc: Greater Portland Metro Area; Lower Columbia
